definition: to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
lit. love the house and its crow (idiom); involvement with sb and everyone connected/Love me, love my dog.
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
soft on the inside despite one's hard shell/appearing tough on the outside as to mask one's inner vulnerability/also written 內柔外剛|内柔外刚[nei4 rou2 wai4 gang1]
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
